channel.title: Need a little help with Autospawn file
channel.description:
Ok, I found a blank source and I went into it and added a npc in the Autospawn "Example" Some Npc's Obviously put anything you want.
Spawn = 1597 3301 3311 0 0 0 0 0 1
I proceeded to click "Compile" The message came up "You have just sucsessfully Compiled, press any key to continue." I click "Runserver.bat".... However he is not were I placed him.. Can someone tell me if I need to add anything?
(NOTE: This is my first time doing this, Please do not Flame me :'(.)

item.title: Need a little help with Autospawn file
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:6, topic:268072”][quote author=FinalFantasy link=topic=353843.msg2711282#msg2711282 date=1237323837]

Ok, I found a blank source and I went into it and added a npc in the Autospawn “Example” Some Npc’s Obviously put anything you want.

Spawn = 1597 3301 3311 0 0 0 0 0 1

I proceeded to click “Compile” The message came up “You have just sucsessfully Compiled, press any key to continue.” I click “Runserver.bat”… However he is not were I placed him… Can someone tell me if I need to add anything?

(NOTE: This is my first time doing this, Please do not Flame me :’(.)

Try:
spawn = 1597 3301 3311 0 3021 4828 2975 4820 1
[/quote]
Wouldn’t that make it have a large walking distance limit?[/quote]

Yes, that’s about it.

Read full topic
item.source: Need a little help with Autospawn file

item.title: Need a little help with Autospawn file
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

You don’t have to compile, you just have to save it and run the server. If that doesn’t work make sure that in your npcHandler it calls for your “autospawn.cfg”

Read full topic
item.source: Need a little help with Autospawn file
